metatags.twitter:title: After 12 years leading Codecademy from inception to a company with more than 50 million learners around the world, tens of millions of dollars of revenue, and an exit last year for more than $525m… | Zach Sims | 231 comments
metatags.og:title: After 12 years leading Codecademy from inception to a company with more than 50 million learners around the world, tens of millions of dollars of revenue, and an exit last year for more than $525m… | Zach Sims | 231 comments
metatags.og:description:
After 12 years leading Codecademy from inception to a company with more than 50 million learners around the world, tens of millions of dollars of revenue, and an exit last year for more than $525m, I’m stepping back from my role as CEO. Leading Codecademy has been the best job I’ve ever had (which is easy to say, because it’s the only job I ever had!). 

When we started Codecademy, Ryan and I thought we were building the easiest way to code. We thought we’d be lucky to get a few hundred people on Columbia University’s campus to use what we’d built. One of the most fulfilling parts about what we’ve built is seeing itss impact both inside the company and outside. At Codecademy, many of our new hires got their start on the same product they now get to work on. I taught at Stanford a few weeks ago and a few of the students thanked Codecademy for getting them into Computer Science (when they were 8! We’re old…). The best part about each day at Codecademy is waking up to a new story from one of ou

socialmediaposting.articlebody: Today is my last day leading @Codecademy after 12 years. @ryanbubinski and I went from a prototype we hacked together in 3 weeks… To a business with more than 50m users that we sold for $500m+....
we have magical intelligence in the sky and magical internet from satellites and yet we cannot have reliable personal hotspots from our iPhones
AI founder going back to their lead investor when the competitive term sheets hit
tweeting as a founder used to be a negative signal. now going direct is table stakes. in a world where anyone can build software in plain english and the cost of execution is being driven down...
i wrote more about this here:
AI makes software development ~2x faster. yet our products aren't evolving 2x as fast. updates aren't arriving 2x as often. where is all this productivity going?
the contrast between a dwarkesh pod (<1 hour, information dense, incisive) and nearly every other popular podcaster (>3.5 hours, meandering, overly flattering) is insane.
it's time to build (a new personal website) learn about me like you learned on codecademy: by doing (and by coding!) think i missed something? run contactMe() or edit the code yourself and...

i should mention it’s best on desktop!
congrats @JackK and team! i’ve used gemini the past few months and it’s awesome.

I stand with Israel in the fight against terrorism and the slaughter of innocent civilians. Hamas’ terrible terrorist attack on innocent civilians is despicable and gut wrenching.

Today is my last day leading @Codecademy after 12 years. @ryanbubinski and I went from a prototype we hacked together in 3 weeks… To a business with more than 50m users that we sold for $500m+....
Most of all, thanks to our amazing learners for trusting us with your future. It's been the honor of a lifetime to help many of you go from nothing to living your dream career. If you have...
a massive thanks as well a few folks who were believers in me and @Codecademy even before day one — @sama, @alexisohanian, @garrytan, @yurimilner_, @jaredhecht, and @smart. thank you!

metatags.og:description: Hi,  I am Jaskaran Rana, a long time codecademy user and the founder of EDM Hunters, a music discovery website for electronic dance music and I’d love to give you a highlight of my story.  Past -   Studied Computer Science in Manipal Institute of Technology, India from 2010-2014 Didn’t know how to code up until my final year, had a 5.0 GPA (we have GPA on a scale of 10 in India) and was barely passing my exams. The way the course was taught, I just couldn’t learn or pay attention in class. Start...
